body:
Testing this one again, after quite a few updates on the underlying packages
(the root cause is indeed the remote circular reference).

Updated test, using latest versions of go-openapi:
* swagger validate: OK
* swagger flatten --with-flatten=minimal (default): OK
* swagger flatten --with-flatten=expand : OK (results in a valid spec, self-contained)
* swagger generate server|model|client (with defaults): OK
* swagger generate server --with-flatten=expand : **error (no longer panics)**
* swagger generate server [expanded spec from above] OK
* swagger expand : OK but the resulting spec is not self-contained (known issue with go-openapi/spec)
The error  now caught is nil value has not field "business", which is a recent addition (precisely to avoid a panics).
TL,DR: everything works fine (after all updates are merged into go-swagger) BUT the edge case with --with-flatten=expand

issue.title: fix(spec): rendering a Pristine document should ensure raw is up to date
issue.body:
This PR makes sure that whenever rendering a Pristine document (e.g. to create a clean document from a fresh clone), the raw root doc is up-to-date.

In go-swagger, we modify the spec (e.g. with flatten, expand, ...) and the internal state of the spec document may sometimes need a clean Document to be reconstructed.

* contributes go-swagger/go-swagger#2346

body:
Finally got it.
Expanding schemas with circular $ref tampers somehow with the document cache in the *spec.Spec object.
I could never really find WHERE this nasty bug is in go-openapi/spec. The work around is to clone the spec.
 
The fix plan is in 2 stages:
1. Fix go-openapi loads to make sure we can clone a Document with its underlying spec modified (after flatten)
2. In go-swagger, in the special case of the Expand option, use Pristine() to clone the Document with the updatd spec.

On a trial test, it seems to work pretty good.

issue.title: Expander: the expanded spec is unusable to resolve circular $ref
issue.body:
This is a nasty bug: so far I've failed to nail it.

When expanding schemas in a spec for further use (e.g. validating the spec, flattening it with the expand option),
circular $ref are left in a unusable state in the $ref cache, leading to jsonpointer errors (e.g. "xxx has no key yyy")
when attempting to resolve.

This is for example the root cause for go-swagger/go-swagger#2346.
In go-swagger, it is possible to work around this issue by reloading the spec as a fresh go-openapi/loads.Document,
but this is not ideal.
This workaround is used on 2 occasions in go-swagger:
* https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/blob/55e764c3e84b9d3779835bb0513d7fd292b0a303/generator/spec.go#L54
* https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/pull/3020 (use workaround to fix the above-mentioned issue)

issue.title: fix(flatten): fixed code generation with circular $ref AND expand option
issue.body:
Whenever generating code (server, client) from a spec with the
--with-flatten=expand option,
the spec document is unusable to resolve a circular $ref.

Although the root cause is most likely a bug in
go-openapi/spec/expander.go, an easier resolution path may be adopted
by cloning the loads.Document using a patched version of Pristine().

This PR requires https://github.com/go-openapi/loads/pull/51, as we
want to use Pristine() on a modified version of the spec inside the
loads.Document.

* fixes #2346

Signed-off-by: Frederic BIDON <fredbi@yahoo.com>
